Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Very Reverend Father Nektarios Papazafiropoulos, Archimandrite and Dean of Saint Demetrios Cathedral, 30-11 30th Drive, Astoria, NY 11102.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Constantinides.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Very Reverend Father Nektarios Papazafiropoulos, Archimandrite and Dean of Saint Demetrios Cathedral, 30-11 30th Drive, Astoria, N.Y. 11102.

Council Member Constantinides moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of March 7, 2018 be adopted as printed by Council Member Koslowitz.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Koslowitz moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of March 7, 2018 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor

Communication from the Mayor - Submitting the name of Allen P. Cappelli to the Council for its advice and consent regarding his appointment to the City Planning Commission, Pursuant to Sections 31 and 192 of the City Charter.
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections
Items.MatterName: Allen P. Cappelli, City Planning Commission

Items.Title: Communications from City, County & Borough Offices
Michael M. McSweeney, a candidate for re-appointment by the Council as City Clerk and Clerk of the Council pursuant to Section 48 of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: This Communication was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections
Items.MatterName: Michael M. McSweeney, re-appointment by the Council as City Clerk and Clerk of the Council.

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By Council Member Rodriguez:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20b of the Council and §20-226 or §20-225(g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 227 Dyckman Street, Borough of Manhattan, Community Board No. 12, Application No. 20185240 TCM shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, 221 Dyckman Street, Manhattan (20185240 TCM)

Items.Title: Communication from the Speaker
Discussion of General Orders
Reports of Special Committees
Reports of Standing Committees
Report of the Committee on Environmental Protection
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the creation of wind maps demonstrating wind energy generation potential within the city
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Creation of wind maps demonstrating wind energy generation potential within the city.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city noise control code, the administrative code of the city of New York and the New York city building code, in relation to small wind turbines
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Small wind turbines.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to allowing residential cooperatives to consolidate required energy efficiency reports
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Allowing residential cooperatives to consolidate required energy efficiency reports.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring that all city-owned buildings be powered by green energy sources by 2050
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Requiring that all city-owned buildings be powered by green energy sources by 2050.

Items.Title: Resolution in support of the Governor of New York State in the commitment to and facilitation of the development of large-scale offshore wind projects by 2030.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

The following Council Members formally voted against the passage of this item:
Council Members Borelli and Matteo voted in the negative.

Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Support of the Governor of NYS in the commitment to and facilitation of the development of large-scale offshore wind projects by 2030.

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
A Local Law in relation to allowing food service establishments to charge a COVID-19 recovery charge
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs and Business Licensing
Items.MatterName: Allowing food service establishments to charge a COVID-19 recovery charge.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the fire department’s recruitment of individuals with prior military service
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Emergency Management
Items.MatterName: Fire department’s recruitment of individuals with prior military service.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the fire department to report on ambulance tour coverage by private ambulances
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Emergency Management
Items.MatterName: Requiring the fire department to report on ambulance tour coverage by private ambulances.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the fire department to report on the use of smoke alarms at any fires in which there was a fire related death or life-threatening injury and the existence of fire sprinklers at any fire greater than a first alarm fire
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Emergency Management
Items.MatterName: Requiring the fire dept to report on the use of smoke alarms at any fires in which there was a fire related death or life-threatening injury and the existence of fire sprinklers at any fire greater than a first alarm fire.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to an online list of required reports
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Online list of required reports.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting additional homeless families with children from being housed in private buildings with multiple Class C housing maintenance code violations
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting additional homeless families with children from being housed in private buildings with multiple Class C housing maintenance code violations.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, legislation that would authorize Same-Day Voter Registration in New York, allowing eligible New York City residents to register to vote and cast a ballot at the poll-site on Election Day.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Same-Day Voter Registration in New York

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to city-wide ambient noise level monitoring
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: City-wide ambient noise level monitoring.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the building code of the city of New York, in relation to crane wind restrictions
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Construction Safety - Crane wind restrictions.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to allowing ill or incapacitated street vendors to transfer their license to a family member
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Allowing ill or incapacitated street vendors to transfer their license to a family member

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to annual reporting on unlicensed child care facilities closed by the department of health and mental hygiene
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Mother's Day Package - Annual reporting on unlicensed child care facilities closed by the dept of health and mental hygiene.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to making the reckless operation of a bicycle resulting in death or serious injury a misdemeanor
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Making the reckless operation of a bicycle resulting in death or serious injury a misdemeanor.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Board of Trustees of the State University of New York to require a new application and public hearing when the designated community school district in a charter school application changes.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Board of Trustees of the State University of NY to require a new application and public hearing when the designated community school district in a charter school application changes.

Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Create dating violence education and prevention programs in schools. (A.5354/S.4528)

Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Landlord Accountability Act of 2017 (H.R. 202)

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Creating a mayor’s office of industrial and manufacturing business.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Reporting the locations of vacant properties to each council member.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Emergency Management
Items.MatterName: In relation to ambulances.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city building code and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to egress path markings
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Egress path markings.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting the sale or distribution of single use water bottles on city property
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting the sale or distribution of single use water bottles on city property.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring that public spaces in buildings include labeled waste and recycling receptacles
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MatterName: Requiring that public spaces in buildings include labeled waste and recycling receptacles.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to establishing a goal of zero waste for New York city by 2030
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MatterName: Establishing a goal of zero waste for NYC by 2030.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring usage of full cutoff light fixtures on street lights.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Requiring usage of full cutoff light fixtures on street lights.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to creating a website to produce and sign petitions seeking particular actions by city government
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Technology
Items.MatterName: Creating a website to produce and sign petitions seeking particular actions by city government.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to creating an inter-agency natural disaster displacement assistance task force
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Emergency Management
Items.MatterName: Creating an inter-agency natural disaster displacement assistance task force.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the creation of a residential parking permit system in Northern Manhattan.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Creation of a residential parking permit system in Northern Manhattan.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to penalties for littering from a vehicle
Items.AgendaNote: Preconsidered - Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MatterName: Rat Mitigation Package - Penalties for littering from a vehicle.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to a plan to increase enforcement of littering out of vehicles

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MatterName: Rat Mitigation Package - Plan to increase enforcement of littering out of vehicles.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to an annual helicopter sightseeing plan
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Economic Development
Items.MatterName: An annual helicopter sightseeing plan.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring half of all black cars to be accessible to persons with physical disabilities
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on For-Hire Vehicles
Items.MatterName: Requiring half of all black cars to be accessible to persons with physical disabilities.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to establishing a maximum number of for-hire vehicles affiliated with each base
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on For-Hire Vehicles
Items.MatterName: Establishing a maximum number of for-hire vehicles affiliated with each base.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the siting of for-hire vehicle bases
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on For-Hire Vehicles
Items.MatterName: Siting of for-hire vehicle bases.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to anti-sexual harassment trainings at city agencies, as proposed in introduction number 612-A for the year 2018, and to amend a local law in relation to climate surveys and action plans to combat sexual harassment and equal employment opportunity violations at city agencies, as proposed in introduction number 664-A for the year 2018, in relation to certain amendments
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Women
Items.MatterName: Anti-sexual harassment trainings at city agencies.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Permits authorizing gas restoration after an emergency shut-off.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to establishing a New York City Housing Authority ombudsperson within the department of buildings
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Housing
Items.MatterName: Establishing a NYCHA ombudsperson within the DOB.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the police department and the fire department to notify the New York City Housing Authority of injuries and fatalities occurring in public housing
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Housing
Items.MatterName: Requiring the NYPD and the FDNY to notify NYCHA of injuries and fatalities occurring in public housing.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, legislation to amend the state Paid Family Leave Act to provide workers in New York State with a benefit equal to 100 percent of an employee’s average weekly wage.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MatterName: Amend the state Paid Family Leave Act.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to allowing the department of buildings to issue stop work orders along with notices to revoke work permits
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Requiring the DOB to issue stop work orders along with notices to revoke work permits.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting employment discrimination and discriminatory harassment or violence based on an individual’s reproductive health choices.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil and Human Rights
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting employment discrimination and discriminatory harassment or violence based on an individual’s reproductive health choices.

Items.Title: Resolution applauding the US Court of Appeals’ Second Circuit decision recognizing protections for Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, Queer, Transgender and Gender Non-Conforming employees from employment discrimination under Title VII of the Civil Rights Act, denouncing the US Department of Justice’s repeated attempts to deny civil rights protections to members of the LGBQ-TGNC community, and calling on the US Supreme Court to uphold the rights of LGBQ-TGNC individuals.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil and Human Rights
Items.MatterName: Applauding the US Court of Appeals’ Second Circuit decision recognizing protections for Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, Queer, Transgender and Gender Non-Conforming employees from employment discrimination.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, A02977/S04363, which would establish a center for research into firearm-related violence and a firearm research fund
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Establish a center for research into firearm-related violence and a firearm research fund. (A02977/S04363)

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to studying the feasibility of providing childcare for city employees
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Providing on-site childcare for city employees.
